item.title: CS 6200 Week 1 Notes
item.description: C Tutorial Essential C Pointers and Memory What is an Operating System An operating system abstract and arbitrary the use of underlying hardware OS modes OS has two modes, (privileged) kernel mode and (unprivileged) user mode. Kernel mode allows access to hardware while user mode does not. If application tries to access hardware directly, that instruction will be trapped and OS will step in to verify if the instruction should go through or not.
